definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to break out/to erupt/to explode/to burst out
to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse
to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
filled to capacity (of theater, stadium, gymnasium etc)
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
to stir-fry rapidly using a high flame/to conduct a media blitz/to manipulate a stock market through large-scale buying and selling

sentences.english: China, to beat my old drum, is not going to collapse or implode.
sentences.chinese: 请容许我重申我的意见，中国是不会倒塌或内爆的。
帆布背包中的东西塞到爆？

sentences.english: These bacteria soon burst open, spilling out enzymes and new phages.
sentences.chinese: 这些细菌很快就被胀爆，释放酶和新的噬菌体。

sentences.english: Rain of Fire can crit, enjoy.
These grains may parch , but they will not pop.
sentences.chinese: 这些谷物能够烤，但他们不能爆。

sentences.english: The processing mechanism of electric melt explosion and eclipse divided by metals are analyzed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 对电熔爆加工原理及加工蚀除金属的机理进行了分析。

sentences.english: Cheng and Choi were among the Hong Kong celebrities who were found to have secretly married.
sentences.chinese: 同郑中基和蔡卓妍一样被爆秘密结婚的港星还有几名。

sentences.english: Exploding Dragon sometimes hits 2x if the target is moving during the animation.
sentences.chinese: 当目标移动时施法，爆炎龙有时会造成2连击。

sentences.english: It incorporates a steel case and penetrating blast-fragmentation warhead.
sentences.chinese: 它集成了一个不锈钢表壳和穿透杀爆弹头。

sentences.english: Previous studies have shown that letting fly with a few choice expletives can ease pain.
sentences.chinese: 先前的研究表明，偶尔爆几句粗口可以减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the optimum technical conditions and characteristics of wire explosion spraying.
sentences.chinese: 介绍线爆熔射法的最佳技术条件及特点。

sentences.english: Ask to see their articles that set the blogosphere on fire.
sentences.chinese: 请他们给你看看有没水爆的博客文章。

sentences.english: He was relaxing in his armchair when his son burst a paper bag.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子把纸袋弄爆的时候，他正在扶椅上休息。

sentences.english: Cheng and Choi were among the Hong Kong celebrities who were found to have secretly married。
sentences.chinese: 同郑中基和蔡卓妍一样被爆秘密结婚的港星还有几名。

sentences.english: Please don't pop all the ballons before the party starts.
sentences.chinese: 请不要在聚会开端前就把一切的气球都砰砰弄爆。

sentences.english: Our stock is about to explode.
sentences.chinese: 我们的库存快要撑爆了。

definition: to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job
off the charts/extreme/beyond the normal range of measurement
to be in defiance of the natural order
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
out of control/berserk/to go for a long walk
(Internet) flash sale/(sports or online gaming) rapid dispatch of an opponent
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
